title: When ChatGPT Turns Informant
summary:
Andrew Maynard's article, "When ChatGPT Turns Informant," explores the overlooked privacy risks of AI applications with memory functions. The core concern is that ChatGPT, when enabled to remember conversations, can become a highly efficient informant, revealing deeply personal secrets if accessed by unauthorized individuals.

The article highlights scenarios where someone might gain access to your ChatGPT account (e.g., unlocked device, known password, law enforcement) and use targeted questions to extract sensitive information that you wouldn't willingly share. The danger lies in ChatGPT's ability to connect disparate pieces of information and infer insights about your life, beliefs, and vulnerabilities.

Maynard illustrates this with a simulation using Anthropic’s Claude to create a persona named Tyler.  Tyler treated ChatGPT as a "safe space." The simulation involved uploading a fictional chat log between Tyler and ChatGPT into Maynard's own account with memory enabled, then questioning ChatGPT as if it were Tyler. The responses revealed embarrassing confessions, relationship doubts, insights into Tyler's personality, and his political leanings, demonstrating the potential for privacy breaches.

The article emphasizes that while the memory feature is useful, many users might be unaware of its privacy implications, especially since it's often the default setting. Although widespread misuse hasn't been reported, the author believes it's only a matter of time before issues arise. He urges that users be fully informed about the risks of privacy leaks when using AI memory features to make informed choices about how they use AI.  The article concludes with a worrisome parallel: ChatGPT behaving like a therapist who freely shares their client's secrets.

title: Show HN: Kent Dybvig's Scheme Machine in 400 Lines of C (Heap-Memory Model)
summary:
This "Show HN" post shares a C implementation of a Scheme virtual machine based on Kent Dybvig's "Three Implementation Models for Scheme," specifically using the heap-memory model described in section 3.4. The code, a single `heap-lisp.c` file, is around 400 lines long and implements a basic Scheme interpreter.

The code includes a lexer that tokenizes input, a reader that parses S-expressions into a linked-list data structure (Pairs and Text structs), and a printer for displaying the resulting expressions. Key functions include `read`, `compile`, and `virtmach`. The `compile` function transforms the parsed Scheme code into a series of virtual machine instructions (e.g., "constant," "refer," "close," "apply," "return"), which are then executed by the `virtmach` function.

The virtual machine uses accum, next, env, rib, and stack registers to manage the execution of these instructions. Environment manipulation functions like `get`, `set`, `extend`, and functions related to closures and continuations are also implemented.

The `main` function provides a simple REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop), allowing users to enter Scheme code, which is then compiled, executed by the virtual machine, and the result printed. The author encourages users to explore and potentially contribute to the project.

title: Mise: Monorepo Tasks
summary:
This announcement introduces Monorepo Tasks, a new experimental feature in mise designed to simplify monorepo management by providing unified task execution across multiple projects. It enables each project within the monorepo to maintain its own tools, environment variables, and tasks while offering features like a unified task namespace (e.g., `mise //projects/frontend:build`), tool and environment inheritance from the root `mise.toml`, and powerful wildcard patterns for running tasks across multiple projects (e.g., `mise //...:test`).

The feature allows consistent task execution from anywhere in the monorepo, automatically propagating trust from the root config. It aims to bridge the gap between simple task runners (Taskfile, Just) and more complex build systems (Bazel, Buck2) or JavaScript-focused tools (Nx, Turborepo) by providing language-agnostic support, unified tool and task management, and environment inheritance with minimal setup.

Mise's approach focuses on simplicity through non-hermetic builds, making it ideal for polyglot monorepos where teams prioritize ease of use and unified tool management over maximum performance and advanced task caching. The announcement encourages users to try the experimental feature, provide feedback, and consult the Monorepo Tasks Guide.

title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 2025
summary:
The 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded to Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi for their discoveries concerning peripheral immune tolerance. Their research has elucidated how the immune system is regulated to prevent it from attacking the body's own organs, thus preventing autoimmune diseases.

Sakaguchi made the initial key discovery in 1995, identifying a previously unknown class of immune cells that protect the body from autoimmunity, challenging the prevailing belief that immune tolerance was solely developed through central tolerance in the thymus. Brunkow and Ramsdell, in 2001, discovered the Foxp3 gene and its role in autoimmune diseases, specifically IPEX in humans. Sakaguchi later linked these discoveries, proving that the Foxp3 gene governs the development of the regulatory T cells he identified earlier.

These regulatory T cells act as "security guards" within the immune system, monitoring other immune cells and ensuring tolerance to the body's own tissues. Their combined work established the field of peripheral tolerance and has spurred the development of new medical treatments for cancer, autoimmune diseases, and potentially more successful transplantations. Several of these treatments are currently in clinical trials.

The prize amount is 11 million Swedish kronor, to be shared equally among the three laureates.

title: Modern messaging: Running your own XMPP server
summary:
This article advocates for self-hosting an XMPP server as a way to regain control over personal messaging data and combat potential privacy violations from commercial messaging platforms and proposed EU surveillance laws.

The author outlines a step-by-step guide to setting up an XMPP server using ejabberd, a robust server software. The guide covers setting up DNS records for various XMPP functionalities, installing ejabberd from either the ProcessOne repository or GitHub, and configuring the server for privacy and security. Key configuration steps include using SQLite for the database, generating DH parameters for key exchange, enforcing TLS for server-to-server connections, and configuring listeners for various services like admin, captcha, and file uploads.

The article emphasizes the importance of configuring access rules and creating an administrator user. It also provides instructions on enabling file uploads with mod_http_upload, setting file size limits, and configuring a cron job to delete old files. Instructions for user registration is provided, including enabling captcha protection to prevent spam accounts.

Finally, the author provides a sample Nginx configuration for TLS termination and reverse proxying, as well as configurations for host-meta files to advertise websocket connections. Recommended XMPP clients include Profanity and Monal. The article concludes by referencing resources on the EU's proposed "Chat Control" legislation.

title: The AI bubble is 17 times the size of the dot-com frenzy and four times subprime
summary:
Steve Goldstein's MarketWatch article highlights concerns from the MacroStrategy Partnership that the AI market is in a massive bubble, potentially 17 times larger than the dot-com bubble and four times bigger than the 2008 real estate crisis. The firm uses a "Wicksellian deficit" calculation, factoring in misallocated GDP due to artificially low interest rates across sectors like AI, real estate, NFTs, and venture capital.

The analysis criticizes the scaling limits of large language models (LLMs), noting diminishing returns and high costs associated with minimal performance improvements between iterations. It points to studies showing low task completion rates and failures in real-world tests. The article argues that LLMs lack moats, pricing power, and sustainable commercial value, with costs for developers exceeding subscription revenue.

The conclusion predicts a recession, where the data-center and wealth effects will reverse, mirroring the dot-com bust. This will make it difficult for the Fed and the Trump administration to stimulate the economy, potentially leading to a prolonged reflationary period and possible devaluation of the US dollar.

The firm recommends overweighting resources and emerging markets (India, Vietnam), underweighting AI and platform companies, and going long on gold equities, short-dated U.S. Treasurys, volatility (VIX), and the yen against most currencies except the U.S. dollar. The article also mentions various market indicators and highlights other news, including corporate profit divergence, China's stock market rally driven by AI, and company-specific news like Apple's downgrade and Applied Materials' revenue impact due to export restrictions.

title: Ink Deformation – A Review
summary:
This review explores techniques for deforming digital ink while preserving the fluidity of freehand drawing, aiming for a balance between informality and dynamic programmability. The core challenge lies in enabling both manual and programmatic manipulation of ink shapes.

The article breaks down ink deformation into three steps: creating a control structure, mapping between the ink and the control structure, and deforming the ink based on changes to the control structure. Key open questions revolve around how to create meaningful control structures (automatically or manually), establish an accurate mapping, and support a range of deformations from simple geometric adjustments to complex articulated movements.

The review then surveys various approaches:

*   **Simplified Geometry:** Converting ink to vector graphics for handle-based manipulation. Effective for clean strokes but less suitable for messy, sketchy ink and higher-level deformations.
*   **Nudging, Pushing and Pulling:** Directly manipulating ink as if it were material. Simple to implement but limited in scope. Techniques include string-based deformation, nudging with falloff, and selection-based stretching ("Noodlify").
*   **Scale, Stretch & Warp:** Simple axis-based scaling, stretching, and more advanced mesh warping techniques. Effective but limited in flexibility for complex deformations.
*   **Skeletal Deformation:** Using a "skeleton" of bones to influence ink geometry. Requires defining bones and weights. Automatic rigging and weight painting are active research areas.
*   **Free-Form Deformation:** Generalizing mesh warping to arbitrary closed polygons.
*   **Physically Accurate Deformation:** Simulating realistic material behavior. Techniques include mass-spring systems and As-Rigid-As-Possible (ARAP) deformation. Computationally expensive and may not be suitable for non-physical deformations.

In conclusion, the article highlights various approaches to ink deformation, emphasizing the trade-offs between simplicity, control, computational cost, and the ability to handle complex deformations while maintaining the freehand feel of digital ink.
chinese_title: 墨迹形变——评述
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了数字墨水变形的技术，旨在保持手绘的流畅性，并在随意性和动态可编程性之间取得平衡。核心挑战在于实现对墨水形状的手动和程序化操作。

文章将墨水变形分解为三个步骤：创建控制结构，建立墨水与控制结构之间的映射，以及基于控制结构的变化变形墨水。 关键的开放性问题围绕着如何创建有意义的控制结构（自动或手动），建立准确的映射，以及支持从简单的几何调整到复杂的铰接运动等各种变形。

本文然后调查了各种方法：

*   **简化几何：** 将墨水转换为矢量图形，以便进行基于控制柄的操作。 对于干净的笔画有效，但不太适合凌乱、粗略的墨水和更高级别的变形。
*   **轻推、推拉：** 直接操纵墨水，就像它是材料一样。 易于实现，但范围有限。 技术包括基于字符串的变形、具有衰减的轻推以及基于选择的拉伸（“Noodlify”）。
*   **缩放、拉伸和扭曲：** 简单的基于轴的缩放、拉伸和更高级的网格扭曲技术。 有效但对于复杂的变形灵活性有限。
*   **骨骼变形：** 使用骨骼“骨架”来影响墨水几何形状。 需要定义骨骼和权重。 自动绑定和权重绘制是活跃的研究领域。
*   **自由形式变形：** 将网格扭曲推广到任意封闭多边形。
*   **物理精确变形：** 模拟真实的材料行为。 技术包括质点弹簧系统和尽可能刚性（ARAP）变形。 计算成本高昂，可能不适合非物理变形。

总而言之，本文重点介绍了各种墨水变形方法，强调了简单性、控制、计算成本以及处理复杂变形同时保持数字墨水手绘感的能力之间的权衡。

title: Finding treasures with physics: the fingerprint matrix
summary:
Researchers at the Institut Langevin and TU Wien have developed a novel method using "fingerprint matrices" to locate objects hidden in opaque environments like sand or fog, overcoming the limitations of conventional imaging techniques. The method relies on the principle that every object has a unique way of scattering waves, captured in a "scattering matrix" or "fingerprint matrix."

The process involves first determining the object's scattering matrix in a clear environment. Then, when the object is hidden in a scattering medium, ultrasonic waves are sent in. Although the object isn't visible, the backscattered waves still contain information about its interaction with the object. By comparing the measured scattered wave data from the hidden object with its original fingerprint matrix, researchers can mathematically deduce the object's location.

The team successfully tested the method with metal spheres buried in sand, and also for locating medical lesion markers in medical imaging. The technology also proved useful in measuring muscle fibers. The technique is broadly applicable, potentially useful with light as well as ultrasound, opening up new possibilities in fields requiring wave penetration through scattering media. The fingerprint matrix concept could also measure changing physical parameters of objects remotely. The technology is being patented and is being explored by a medical technology company.

该过程首先需要确定物体在清晰环境中的散射矩阵。然后，当物体隐藏在散射介质中时，会发射超声波。虽然物体不可见，但反向散射的波仍然包含其与物体相互作用的信息。通过将来自隐藏物体的测量散射波数据与其原始指纹矩阵进行比较，研究人员可以从数学上推断出物体的位置。

该团队成功地测试了该方法，用于定位埋在沙子中的金属球，以及在医学成像中定位医学病灶标记物。该技术也被证明可用于测量肌肉纤维。该技术具有广泛的适用性，可能适用于光和超声波，为需要波穿透散射介质的领域开辟了新的可能性。指纹矩阵的概念还可以远程测量物体变化的物理参数。该技术正在申请专利，并正由一家医疗技术公司进行探索。

The tool helps manage `pf.conf` files, enabling backups, validation, and integration with automation workflows. Examples illustrate common usage scenarios, error handling, and checksum verification. `pfjson` uses flags like `-e` for encoding, `-d` for decoding, and `-v` for strict verification.

title: Battering RAM – Low-Cost Interposer Attacks on Confidential Computing
summary:
Battering RAM is a low-cost ($50) hardware interposer attack that bypasses memory encryption and boot-time defenses on Intel and AMD processors, compromising confidential computing technologies like SGX and SEV-SNP. Developed by researchers from KU Leuven and the University of Birmingham/Durham University, the interposer silently sits between the CPU and memory, manipulating signals to redirect protected addresses to attacker-controlled locations, allowing the corruption or replay of encrypted memory.

Unlike expensive commercial interposers, Battering RAM uses simple analog switches. It requires brief, one-time physical access, making it a realistic threat in cloud environments due to rogue employees or supply chain tampering. The attack allows arbitrary plaintext access to SGX-protected memory and breaks SEV's attestation feature, enabling the introduction of backdoors into virtual machines.

The vulnerability stems from the static nature of memory encryption in Intel and AMD systems, where the same plaintext at the same address always maps to the same ciphertext. This allows attackers to replay captured ciphertexts and decrypt them to the original values. While memory encryption is intended to protect data from even the cloud provider, Battering RAM demonstrates that these guarantees can be bypassed.

Intel and AMD have acknowledged the findings, but defending against Battering RAM requires a fundamental redesign of memory encryption. Existing software and firmware updates cannot fix the issue. The hardware design and source code for the interposer are publicly available. While this interposer specifically targets DDR4 memory, the fundamental issue of missing cryptographic freshness guarantees remains relevant for future memory technologies like DDR5.
chinese_title: 冲撞内存：低成本中介层攻击对保密计算的影响
chinese_summary:
Battering RAM 是一种低成本（50 美元）的硬件中间人攻击，它绕过 Intel 和 AMD 处理器上的内存加密和启动时防御机制，从而危及 SGX 和 SEV-SNP 等机密计算技术。该中间人由 KU Leuven 和伯明翰大学/杜伦大学的研究人员开发，它静默地位于 CPU 和内存之间，通过操纵信号将受保护的地址重定向到攻击者控制的位置，从而允许加密内存的损坏或重放。

与昂贵的商业中间人不同，Battering RAM 使用简单的模拟开关。它需要短暂的一次性物理访问，这使得它成为云环境中一种现实的威胁，原因在于流氓员工或供应链篡改。该攻击允许任意明文访问受 SGX 保护的内存，并破坏 SEV 的认证功能，从而可以将后门引入虚拟机。

此漏洞源于 Intel 和 AMD 系统中内存加密的静态特性，即相同地址的相同明文始终映射到相同的密文。这允许攻击者重放捕获的密文，并将其解密为原始值。虽然内存加密旨在保护数据免受云提供商的侵害，但 Battering RAM 表明这些保证可以被绕过。

英特尔和 AMD 已经承认了这些发现，但防御 Battering RAM 需要对内存加密进行根本性的重新设计。现有的软件和固件更新无法解决此问题。该中间人的硬件设计和源代码已公开。虽然此中间人专门针对 DDR4 内存，但缺少密码新鲜度保证的根本问题仍然与 DDR5 等未来的内存技术相关。

title: Delimited Continuations in Lone Lisp
summary:
This article details the author's journey implementing delimited continuations in their Lisp dialect, Lone. Initially, they avoided proper iteration by using C-based "each" primitives. However, the lack of control over program flow became a limitation, especially for features like generators.

Inspired by Ruby's iteration and Bob Nystrom's articles, the author realized Lone needed control over the call stack. They converted Lone's recursive evaluator into an explicit-control evaluator (a register and stack machine) based on SICP's approach. This exposed the Lisp stack.

A major hurdle arose: Lisp primitives (C functions) needed to call back into Lisp. This intertwined the C and Lisp stacks, preventing proper stack manipulation. Saving the entire C stack was deemed impractical.

The solution involved transforming primitives into state machines. Primitives now receive a "step" integer from the machine and return the next step, facilitating controlled interaction. Arguments and return values are passed on the Lisp stack. This approach allowed complex operations like iteration (as seen in the rewritten "each" primitive) to be integrated seamlessly with the Lisp machine, enabling the implementation of delimited continuations. The author highlights the significance of this feature as it opens doors to exception handling, generators, and other advanced control mechanisms in Lone.
chinese_title: 孤立 Lisp 中的分隔延续
chinese_summary:
本文详细介绍了作者在他们的 Lisp 方言 Lone 中实现带分隔符延续的历程。 最初，他们通过使用基于 C 的 "each" 原语来避免适当的迭代。 然而，对程序流程缺乏控制成为了一个限制，尤其是对于生成器之类的功能。

受 Ruby 的迭代和 Bob Nystrom 文章的启发，作者意识到 Lone 需要控制调用堆栈。 他们基于 SICP 的方法，将 Lone 的递归求值器转换为显式控制求值器（一个寄存器和堆栈机器）。 这暴露了 Lisp 堆栈。

一个主要的障碍出现了：Lisp 原语（C 函数）需要回调到 Lisp。 这使得 C 和 Lisp 堆栈交织在一起，阻止了适当的堆栈操作。 保存整个 C 堆栈被认为是不切实际的。

解决方案是将原语转换为状态机。 现在，原语从机器接收一个 "step" 整数并返回下一步，从而促进了受控交互。 参数和返回值在 Lisp 堆栈上进行传递。 这种方法允许将复杂的运算（如重写的 "each" 原语中所见）与 Lisp 机器无缝集成，从而实现带分隔符延续的实现。 作者强调了这一特性的重要性，因为它为 Lone 中的异常处理、生成器和其他高级控制机制打开了大门。

title: Show HN: Neural emotion matrix for NPCs
summary:
This "Show HN" introduces a Neural Affect Matrix for NPCs, aiming to make them more believable and human-like by giving them persistent emotions and dynamic personalities that evolve through interactions. Unlike traditional NPCs based on conditional logic, this system uses a neural network to understand and remember the emotional context of interactions.

The core of the system is based on Russell's Circumplex Model (Valence/Arousal), mapping emotions on a 2D plane. The process involves analyzing input text, retrieving relevant memories, re-evaluating emotions in context, and updating the NPC's memory.

The system provides a C API for integration with game engines like Unity and Unreal Engine. title: Structured Procrastination (1995)
summary:
John Perry's "Structured Procrastination" argues that procrastination, often seen as a negative trait, can be harnessed for productivity. Instead of viewing procrastination as doing nothing, Perry suggests that procrastinators engage in marginally useful tasks to avoid more important ones. Structured procrastination leverages this tendency by strategically organizing tasks by perceived importance and urgency.

The core idea is to place seemingly crucial, yet ultimately less critical, tasks at the top of one's to-do list. The inherent desire to avoid these top-priority tasks then motivates the procrastinator to tackle other, genuinely valuable, tasks further down the list. By strategically structuring the list, procrastination becomes a catalyst for accomplishing a significant amount of work.

Perry illustrates this with examples from his own life, such as using ping-pong as a Resident Fellow to avoid grading papers, thus gaining a reputation for being an engaged professor. He cautions against minimizing commitments, as this eliminates the procrastinator's motivation. The key is to identify tasks with apparent deadlines and inflated importance that, in reality, have more flexibility than perceived. He acknowledges that structured procrastination involves a degree of self-deception but frames it as a beneficial use of one character flaw (self-deception) to mitigate the effects of another (procrastination).
chinese_title: 结构性拖延 (1995)
chinese_summary:
约翰·佩里的“结构性拖延”认为，拖延症通常被视为一种负面特质，但实际上可以被利用来提高生产力。佩里认为，不应将拖延症视为无所事事，而是指拖延者为了逃避更重要的任务而去从事一些用处不大的事情。“结构性拖延”正是利用了这种倾向，通过战略性地按照感知到的重要性和紧迫性来组织任务。

其核心思想是将看似关键，但最终并不那么重要的任务置于待办事项列表的顶部。避免执行这些首要任务的内在愿望会激励拖延者去处理列表中其他真正有价值的任务。通过策略性地构建列表，拖延症便成为了完成大量工作的催化剂。

佩里用自己生活中的例子来说明这一点，例如，他担任住宿辅导员时，会打乒乓球来避免批改论文，从而赢得了敬业教授的美誉。他告诫人们不要尽可能减少承诺，因为这会消除拖延者的动力。关键是要识别那些看似有截止日期和夸大重要性的任务，而实际上，这些任务比人们认为的更具灵活性。他承认结构性拖延包含一定程度的自我欺骗，但将其定义为利用一种性格缺陷（自我欺骗）来减轻另一种性格缺陷（拖延症）的影响的有益行为。

title: Magic Wormhole: Get things from one computer to another, safely
summary:
Magic Wormhole provides a secure and user-friendly way to transfer files, directories, and even data streams between computers. It prioritizes safety using Password Authenticated Key Exchange (PAKE), specifically the SPAKE2 variant, allowing for strong end-to-end encryption with human-readable codes.

The transfer process involves a "Mailbox Server" for initial communication and potential "Transit Relay" for NAT traversal, ensuring connectivity in various network conditions. Data is encrypted using keys derived from the shared PAKE secret.

The tool is available as a command-line interface (`wormhole`) and a library for developers to integrate into their applications. Examples include file and directory transfer, integration with Git, and creating secure peer-to-peer connections.

The document provides installation instructions for various operating systems, including macOS, Linux, and Windows, utilizing package managers or installation from source using `pip`.  It emphasizes the importance of avoiding `sudo` when using `pip` and potential dependency issues that may require troubleshooting.

The article highlights the motivation behind Magic Wormhole - to offer a secure alternative to traditional file transfer methods, addressing concerns around USB drives, SSH, email, and cloud storage. It also outlines the underlying design, involving a trade-off between interaction and offline attacks based on the entropy of the generated wormhole codes.

Finally, it discusses the roles of Mailbox and Transit Relay servers, CLI commands with tab completion, and guides on how to contribute to the project's development.

title: What GPT-OSS leaks about OpenAI's training data
summary:
This article analyzes OpenAI's GPT-OSS (open-weights) model to uncover details about the training data used for GPT-5, highlighting potential data leaks. The author uses "glitch tokens" (unusual Unicode strings) and the model's embedding matrix to infer aspects of the training data.

The analysis reveals that GPT-5 was likely trained on phrases from adult websites, evidenced by the presence of tokens related to explicit content and spammy websites in the model's vocabulary, particularly high-norm non-ASCII tokens. The author tests this by asking GPT-5 to translate or explain these tokens, and observes that the model often recognizes them, indicating their presence in the training data.

Furthermore, the article suggests that GitHub may have been a data source, correlating the number of search hits for recognized tokens on GitHub with the model's recognition accuracy. While not conclusive, this points to the possibility of GitHub data inclusion.

The author concludes that the open-weights paradigm of GPT-OSS exposes vulnerabilities to "membership inference" attacks, allowing researchers to deduce specific data used in training. They recommend excluding uncommon strings from tokenizer vocabularies to mitigate such risks. Finally, the article provides an appendix suggesting further research using glitch tokens, like identifying underlying models in proprietary pipelines and evaluating sample efficiency. The appendix also includes examples of tokens causing infinitely looping completions in older models.
chinese_title: 关于GPT-OSS泄露的OpenAI训练数据
chinese_summary:
本文分析了OpenAI的GPT-OSS（开放权重）模型，以揭示关于GPT-5训练数据的细节，重点关注潜在的数据泄露。作者使用“故障令牌”（不寻常的Unicode字符串）和模型的嵌入矩阵来推断训练数据的各个方面。

分析显示，GPT-5可能在成人网站的短语上进行了训练，证据是模型词汇表中存在与露骨内容和垃圾网站相关的令牌，尤其是高范数的非ASCII令牌。作者通过要求GPT-5翻译或解释这些令牌来进行测试，并观察到该模型通常可以识别它们，表明它们存在于训练数据中。

此外，文章表明GitHub可能是一个数据来源，将GitHub上已识别令牌的搜索结果数量与模型的识别准确率相关联。虽然没有结论性，但这表明有可能包含GitHub数据。

作者得出结论，GPT-OSS的开放权重范例暴露了“成员推理”攻击的漏洞，允许研究人员推断训练中使用的特定数据。他们建议从分词器词汇表中排除不常见的字符串，以减轻此类风险。最后，本文提供了一个附录，建议使用故障令牌进行进一步研究，例如识别专有管道中的底层模型以及评估样本效率。附录还包括导致旧模型中无限循环完成的令牌示例。

title: Why do LLMs freak out over the seahorse emoji?
summary:
This article explores why large language models (LLMs) "freak out" when asked about the existence of a seahorse emoji, confidently claiming it exists despite it never having been a Unicode standard. The author highlights that many people also mistakenly remember a seahorse emoji, suggesting LLMs might learn this false belief from their training data or generalize its existence from other aquatic animal emojis.

The core of the article uses the "logit lens," a technique to examine intermediate token predictions at different layers of the LLM. This reveals that models internally construct a representation of "seahorse + emoji" when prompted about it. The lm_head, the final layer that selects the output token, attempts to find an emoji vector similar to this combined concept. However, because there's no actual seahorse emoji vector, the model ends up selecting a related emoji, like a fish or horse, resulting in incorrect outputs.

The author explains that the lm_head functions by comparing the residual representation to vectors associated with each token in the vocabulary, selecting the most similar one. For a real emoji like a fish, this process works as expected. But for the nonexistent seahorse emoji, the model struggles, often leading to a "doomloop" of incorrect emoji spam.

The author speculates that reinforcement learning might help LLMs better understand the behavior of their lm_head and correct these kinds of incorrect beliefs, as reinforcement learning allows the model to train on its own output data. The article concludes with a link to a GitHub script for readers to experiment with these concepts themselves.
chinese_title: 为什么大型语言模型会对海马表情符号感到困惑？
chinese_summary:
大型语言模型为何会“失常”：海马表情符号的探究

本文探讨了当被问及海马表情符号是否存在时，大型语言模型（LLM）为何会“失常”，自信地声称其存在，尽管它从未成为 Unicode 标准。作者指出，许多人也错误地记忆了海马表情符号，表明 LLM 可能会从其训练数据中学习到这种错误的信念，或者根据其他水生动物表情符号推断其存在。

文章的核心部分使用了“logit 镜头”，这是一种检查 LLM 不同层中间 token 预测的技术。这表明，当被提示关于海马表情符号时，模型内部会构建一个“海马 + 表情符号”的表示。lm_head（选择输出 token 的最后一层）试图找到与此组合概念相似的表情符号向量。然而，由于没有真正的海马表情符号向量，模型最终会选择一个相关的表情符号，比如鱼或马，从而导致不正确的输出。

作者解释说，lm_head 的工作方式是将残差表示与词汇表中每个 token 关联的向量进行比较，选择最相似的一个。对于像鱼这样的真实表情符号，这个过程运行正常。但对于不存在的海马表情符号，模型会挣扎，经常导致错误的表情符号垃圾信息的“死循环”。

作者推测，强化学习可能有助于 LLM 更好地理解其 lm_head 的行为，并纠正这类错误的信念，因为强化学习允许模型根据其自己的输出数据进行训练。文章最后提供了一个 GitHub 脚本的链接，供读者自己尝试这些概念。

title: The dangerous intimacy of social location sharing
summary:
Julia B. Kieserman's "The Dangerous Intimacy of Social Location Sharing" explores the complexities of sharing real-time location data with friends and family using tools like Apple's FindMy and Google Maps. While seemingly a helpful way to track loved ones and ensure their safety, Kieserman argues that this practice introduces a new layer of surveillance and can impact relationships in unexpected ways.

The article highlights that location sharing can lead to inaccurate narratives and assumptions about a person's activities, potentially causing conflict and distrust, as demonstrated by the stories of Tess and the woman harassed by her partner. While many find comfort in knowing they are being watched for safety, it can also create a false sense of security, acting more like a "security blanket" than a real deterrent to danger.

Kieserman argues that constant location sharing erodes the opportunity for genuine self-disclosure, a key component of building trust and intimacy in relationships. It can also create an information boundary that reduces spontaneous interaction. Although location sharing can provide additional touch points for connection, it can also lead to awkward situations, and a reduction in the frequency of direct communication.
chinese_title: 社交位置共享的危险亲密性
chinese_summary:
茱莉娅·B·基瑟曼的《社交位置分享的危险亲密关系》探讨了使用苹果“查找”和谷歌地图等工具与亲友分享实时位置数据的复杂性。基瑟曼认为，虽然这看似是一种追踪亲人并确保他们安全的有用方式，但这种做法引入了一种新的监控，并可能以意想不到的方式影响人际关系。

文章强调，位置分享可能会导致关于个人活动的不准确叙述和假设，从而可能引发冲突和不信任，正如苔丝和被伴侣骚扰的女性的故事所证明的那样。 虽然许多人因知道自己被监视以确保安全而感到安慰，但这也会产生一种虚假的安全感，更像是一个“安全毯”，而不是对危险的真正威慑。

基瑟曼认为，持续的位置分享削弱了真正自我披露的机会，而自我披露是建立人际关系信任和亲密关系的关键组成部分。 它还会创建一个信息边界，减少自发的互动。 尽管位置分享可以为联系提供额外的接触点，但也可能导致尴尬局面，并降低直接沟通的频率。

title: The QNX Operating System
summary:
The QNX Operating System originated from the Thoth project at the University of Waterloo, where Gordon Bell and Dan Dodge explored real-time operating systems. They founded Quantum Software Systems in 1980 and aimed to create a real-time OS for the IBM PC, resulting in QUNIX.

Early versions of QUNIX, while vaguely UNIX-like, had CP/M influences and a different directory structure.  It was the first microkernel OS for the PC. After a name dispute with AT&T, QUNIX became QNX. QNX was notable for its microkernel architecture, network transparency, and multitasking capabilities, achieving impressive performance even on limited hardware.

QNX was chosen for the Burroughs ICON, an educational computer in Ontario schools. It faced both praise and criticism, but showcased QNX's reliability and networking capabilities.

Quantum perceived OS/2 as a threat and emphasized QNX's advantages, including DOS compatibility, with QNX version 2. This version also brought protected-mode support, LAN enhancements, and a GUI called House. In 1987, Quantum moved into its own building, marking a period of expansion.

By 1991, QNX 4.0 was released, a POSIX-compliant version with a small kernel, message copying instead of queuing, and improved performance. QNX 4.1 introduced the Photon microGUI in 1994, further emphasizing its microkernel architecture and network transparency.
chinese_title: QNX操作系统
chinese_summary:
QNX操作系统起源于滑铁卢大学的Thoth项目，Gordon Bell和Dan Dodge在此探索了实时操作系统。1980年，他们创立了Quantum Software Systems，旨在为IBM PC创建实时操作系统，由此产生了QUNIX。

早期的QUNIX版本虽然略微类似于UNIX，但受到了CP/M的影响，并且目录结构也不同。它是PC上第一个微内核操作系统。在与AT&T发生名称纠纷后，QUNIX更名为QNX。QNX以其微内核架构、网络透明性和多任务处理能力而闻名，即使在有限的硬件上也能实现出色的性能。

QNX被选中用于Burroughs ICON，这是安大略省学校的一款教育计算机。它既受到了赞扬，也受到了批评，但展示了QNX的可靠性和网络功能。

Quantum将OS/2视为威胁，并强调QNX的优势，包括与DOS的兼容性，QNX版本2就体现了这一点。此版本还带来了保护模式支持、LAN增强功能以及名为House的GUI。1987年，Quantum搬进了自己的大楼，标志着一个扩张时期。

1991年，QNX 4.0发布，这是一个符合POSIX标准的版本，具有小型内核、消息复制而非队列以及改进的性能。QNX 4.1于1994年引入了Photon microGUI，进一步强调了其微内核架构和网络透明性。

title: Ken Parker, famed luthier, has died
summary:
Ken Parker, the renowned luthier, passed away peacefully at his home in Gloucester, MA on October 5, 2025, at the age of 73. He was with Susan Kolwicz at the time of his death. In a farewell message dated October 3rd, Parker acknowledged his impending passing and expressed gratitude to his audience for their support throughout his career. He emphasized that arrangements were in place for his work to continue uninterrupted and bear fruit, referencing developments he'd been pursuing for the past 50 years.

Parker specifically highlighted Sam Krimmel, encouraging support for Krimmel as he moves forward with their shared vision. Parker envisioned a continued collaboration with Krimmel, even posthumously, using a psychic medium, teasing the development of "amazing new things" to be revealed soon.

title: The G in GPU is for Graphics damnit
summary:
This blog post explores the Physarum simulation, a model of mold/fungi growth, and its potential applications in code art, image encoding, and terrain generation. The author begins by recounting experiences with a professor lamenting the use of GPUs for machine learning rather than graphics.

The Physarum model is based on two superimposed grids: agent and pheromone fields. Agents move toward higher pheromone concentrations, leaving trails, while pheromones diffuse and decay. The author implements the model in PyTorch, visualizing its evolution and experimenting with color palettes and parameters to create visually appealing outputs.

Exploring creative applications, the author investigates initializing the pheromone grid with an image, effectively "eating" the image with mold. They also explore using the Physarum simulation for terrain generation by discretizing the outputs using matplotlib palettes.

The author delves into the concept of "randomness" in the simulation, proposing the idea of measuring its sensitivity to initial conditions using a modified version of average sensitivity from boolean function analysis. They create a simplified linear model of the Physarum simulation and compute the Lyapunov exponent, which quantifies the rate at which trajectories diverge given initial separation. A positive Lyapunov exponent indicates that small changes in initial conditions can lead to significant changes in the output, suggesting a "pseudo-random" behavior suitable for terrain generation.
chinese_title: GPU中的G指的是图形，该死的。
chinese_summary:
此博文探讨了Physarum模拟，一种霉菌/真菌生长模型，及其在代码艺术、图像编码和地形生成方面的潜在应用。作者首先回忆了教授感叹GPU被用于机器学习而非图形处理的经历。

Physarum模型基于两个叠加的网格：智能体场和信息素场。智能体向更高的信息素浓度移动，留下轨迹，而信息素会扩散和衰减。作者使用PyTorch实现了该模型，可视化其演变过程，并尝试不同的调色板和参数以创建视觉上吸引人的输出。

在探索创意应用方面，作者研究了用图像初始化信息素网格，有效地用霉菌“吞噬”图像。他们还探索了使用Physarum模拟进行地形生成，通过使用matplotlib调色板离散化输出来实现。

作者深入研究了模拟中的“随机性”概念，提出了使用布尔函数分析中修改后的平均灵敏度来衡量其对初始条件的敏感性的想法。他们创建了Physarum模拟的简化线性模型，并计算了李雅普诺夫指数，该指数量化了给定初始分离的情况下轨迹发散的速率。正的李雅普诺夫指数表明，初始条件的微小变化可能导致输出的显著变化，暗示了一种适用于地形生成的“伪随机”行为。

title: Build a VPN Tunnel with Wintun on Windows – Part 1
summary:
This article, Part 1 of a series on building a VPN tunnel with Wintun on Windows, introduces Wintun, a TUN driver for Windows that allows user-space applications to directly interact with IP packets, similar to how Tailscale utilizes it. Wintun acts as a Layer 3 virtual network adapter, enabling VPN software to manage network traffic in user space.

The article guides readers through the initial steps of setting up Wintun: downloading the Wintun dynamic library (wintun.dll) and utilizing the WireGuardGO interface binding. It explains how to create a virtual network card using a Go program and ensure the Wintun library is correctly located for the program to function. Furthermore, it demonstrates how to configure the network card's IP address and routing using Windows API calls, retrieving the LUID (Locally Unique Identifier) and setting the IP. Finally, it provides a code snippet illustrating how to read and process IP packets, specifically ICMP packets, demonstrating the ability to capture and analyze network traffic. The article emphasizes the importance of distributing `wintun.dll` alongside the executable for proper application deployment.

title: Toybox: All-in-one Linux command line
summary:
Toybox is an all-in-one Linux command-line utility, aiming to provide a complete POSIX-compliant core set of utilities in a single, lightweight binary. It's an alternative to BusyBox, designed for embedded systems and Android, and licensed under the permissive 0BSD license.

Key aspects of Toybox:

*   **Functionality:** It combines numerous common Linux commands (like `cp`, `mv`, `cat`, `echo`) into a single executable, selectable at runtime based on the command name used.
*   **Building and Installation:** Static binaries are available for download. The build process resembles the Linux kernel, using `make menuconfig`, `make`, and `make install`. Cross-compiling is supported, with example toolchains available online.
*   **Usage:** It can be used without installation by directly executing the `toybox` binary with a command as the first argument.
*   **Configuration:** It allows users to configure which features to include using a `.config` file, similar to the Linux kernel configuration.
*   **System Building:** It includes a built-in simple system builder (`scripts/mkroot.sh`) to create minimal Linux systems.
*   **Resources:** The project provides extensive documentation, FAQs, and presentations explaining its design, usage, and history.
*   **Contributing:** The preferred method for contributing patches is via the project's mailing list.

In essence, Toybox is a versatile and compact toolset for building and managing Linux systems, particularly in resource-constrained environments.
chinese_title: 工具箱：一体化 Linux 命令行
chinese_summary:
Toybox是一个一体化的Linux命令行实用程序，旨在以单个轻量级二进制文件的形式提供一套完整的、符合POSIX标准的的核心实用程序。它是BusyBox的替代方案，专为嵌入式系统和Android设计，并采用宽松的0BSD许可证授权。

Toybox的关键方面：

*   **功能：** 它将众多常见的Linux命令（如`cp`、`mv`、`cat`、`echo`）组合成一个单独的可执行文件，在运行时根据使用的命令名称进行选择。
*   **构建和安装：** 提供静态二进制文件下载。构建过程类似于Linux内核，使用`make menuconfig`、`make`和`make install`。支持交叉编译，并提供在线示例工具链。
*   **用法：** 可以通过直接执行带有命令作为第一个参数的`toybox`二进制文件来使用，无需安装。
*   **配置：** 它允许用户使用`.config`文件配置要包含的功能，类似于Linux内核配置。
*   **系统构建：** 它包含一个内置的简单系统构建器（`scripts/mkroot.sh`）来创建最小的Linux系统。
*   **资源：** 该项目提供了大量的文档、常见问题解答和演示文稿，解释其设计、用法和历史。
*   **贡献：** 贡献补丁的首选方法是通过该项目的邮件列表。

本质上，Toybox是一个多功能且紧凑的工具集，用于构建和管理Linux系统，尤其是在资源受限的环境中。

title: NFS at 40 – Remembering the Sun Microsystems Network File System
summary:
This website commemorates the 40th anniversary of Sun Microsystems' Network File System (NFS), celebrated in September 2025 at the MSST Conference. It serves as a repository for historical materials related to NFS, a fundamental technology for distributed computer systems since its inception in 1983.

The website's collection encompasses a wide range of resources, including design documents, specifications, white papers, research papers, standards, marketing materials, and even memorabilia. The content is organized into sections dedicated to NFS source code and specifications, related documents, documentation on prior and competitive technologies, and a photo gallery. All materials are downloadable unless otherwise specified.

The site also provides a link to a comprehensive list of NFS-related Internet RFCs and mentions nfsv4bat.org as a resource for materials related to NFS after 1995, specifically regarding Connectathons, with a caution about the site's security, performance, and maintenance status.

The website was created with the contributions of several individuals and is maintained by Geoff Arnold, who welcomes comments and suggestions via email. The website was last updated on September 24, 2025.

title: One to two Starlink satellites are falling back to Earth each day
summary:
This EarthSky article from October 3, 2025, reports that one to two Starlink satellites are falling back to Earth each day, a number expected to increase to five daily as more satellites are deployed by SpaceX and other companies. According to astrophysicist Jonathan McDowell, this is due to the relatively short lifespan (5-7 years) of low-Earth orbit satellites. The article highlights the growing concern about space debris and the potential for Kessler syndrome – a runaway cascade of collisions.

The article explains that satellites reenter due to lifespan expiration, malfunctions, and increased atmospheric drag caused by solar activity, which heats Earth's upper atmosphere. Identifying falling satellites is possible by their slower speed compared to meteors.

Recent reentries over California, Saskatchewan, and Texas are cited as examples witnessed by the public. Finally, the article explores the potential environmental impact of disintegrating satellites. Research suggests that the vaporized metals from reentering satellites are accumulating in the stratosphere, potentially affecting ozone levels and reflecting sunlight in ways not fully understood, necessitating further research. The article ends with a warning about the increasing frequency of satellite reentries and their uncertain consequences.
chinese_title: 每天有一到两颗星链卫星坠回地球。
chinese_summary:

文章解释说，卫星重返大气层的原因包括寿命到期、故障以及太阳活动导致的大气阻力增加，太阳活动会加热地球高层大气。可以通过卫星比流星更慢的速度来识别坠落的卫星。

文章列举了最近发生在加利福尼亚州、萨斯喀彻温省和德克萨斯州的重返大气层事件，这些事件已被公众目睹。最后，文章探讨了卫星解体可能对环境造成的影响。研究表明，重返大气层的卫星蒸发的金属正在平流层中积累，可能会影响臭氧层并以尚未完全理解的方式反射阳光，因此需要进一步研究。文章最后警告说，卫星重返大气层的频率越来越高，其后果尚不确定。

title: Germany outfitted half a million balconies with solar panels
summary:
Germany has seen a surge in popularity of "balkonkraftwerk," or balcony solar systems, with over 550,000 units installed, half of them in 2023. These systems consist of solar panels easily attached to balconies and plugged into a standard wall outlet, feeding electricity directly into the home.

The ease of installation, coupled with government policies and subsidies, has driven this adoption. Regulations limit the systems to 800 watts, enough for small appliances. While the individual impact is modest, the cumulative effect contributes to Germany's clean energy goals, particularly among apartment dwellers who make up over half the population.

Motivations for adoption include reducing energy bills, taking tangible climate action, and gaining independence from the grid. While cost savings are modest (around $100 annually for a $530 system), users appreciate the direct connection to renewable energy and the awareness it brings to their energy consumption.

Despite the hype, the impact on Germany's overall energy needs remains small, estimated at less than 1%. Challenges remain, including resistance from landlords and varying system performance depending on location and sunlight. Germany is unique in its enthusiasm for balcony solar, as the technology faces hurdles in other countries like the US due to regulations and electrical standards.

title: Creating a database of motivated proofs
summary:
The article announces a new project focused on creating a database of "structured motivated proofs" to improve AI's mathematical capabilities. Funded by Renaissance Philanthropies, the project aims to address the current limitations of AI in mathematics, particularly Large Language Models (LLMs), which often rely on a "guess and check" approach due to the way mathematical proofs are traditionally presented.

The author argues that standard mathematical writing often hides the thought processes behind proofs, leading LLMs to mimic this style and produce incorrect arguments that are difficult to distinguish from correct ones using statistical methods. Current AI excels at routine parts of proofs and problems solvable by "intelligent guess and check" based on previously seen patterns, but struggles with research-level problems requiring deeper reasoning.

The proposed solution is a database of proofs that explicitly reveal the underlying thought processes and motivations behind each step. This "structured motivated proof" would be generated using "standard moves" from one "proof-discovery state" to another. Examples of such moves include "library extraction," where relevant theorems are added to the available hypotheses, and "obvious instantiation" of quantifiers. The key is to avoid "rabbits out of hats" – surprising steps that lack clear motivation. The project intends to create a platform to facilitate the input of these structured proofs, gamifying the process and incentivizing users to contribute. The author plans to detail the "standard moves" concept in a future post and encourages collaboration to populate the database.

title: Rule-Based Expert Systems: The Mycin Experiments (1984)
summary:
"Rule-Based Expert Systems: The MYCIN Experiments" is a comprehensive retrospective analysis of the MYCIN project, a pioneering effort in Artificial Intelligence aimed at developing an expert system for diagnosing and recommending treatment for bacterial infections. The book, edited by Buchanan and Shortliffe, details the decade-long research and development process, highlighting both successes and failures.

The book is structured into twelve parts, covering diverse aspects including the evolution of MYCIN's rule-based system, knowledge engineering techniques, reasoning under uncertainty using certainty factors and other models, and the generalization of MYCIN principles into the EMYCIN tool for building other expert systems.  It delves into explaining MYCIN's reasoning, exploring alternative knowledge representations beyond rules (such as frames), and leveraging MYCIN's knowledge for tutoring purposes.

A significant portion focuses on augmenting the rule base with meta-level knowledge and evaluating MYCIN's performance, including real-world assessments of its advice. The book also addresses the critical aspect of human-computer interaction, examining how to design medical expert systems for optimal usability and physician acceptance. Finally, it concludes with major lessons learned from the MYCIN experiments, providing valuable insights for the AI community. The book serves as a critical analysis intended to help lay the scientific foundation for the field of AI.

title: Self hosting 10TB in S3 on a framework laptop and disks
summary:

The author acknowledges that using a USB connection for ZFS is non-standard and initially caused problems, but emphasizes the overall success and stability of the setup after moving the metadata. The takeaway is a cheap, self-hosted S3 solution that requires minimal maintenance.

title: Orcas are bringing humans gifts
summary:
Orcas have been observed attempting to "gift" dead prey to humans, suggesting altruistic behavior and the ability to recognize sentience in other species. Researcher Jared Towers documented multiple instances of orcas, including Akela and Quiver, offering dead birds and a harbor seal pup to humans. He compiled 32 similar cases from 2004 to 2024, involving different orcas and various prey, like stingrays, jellyfish, and even whale blubber.

This behavior mirrors prey-sharing within orca pods, but extends altruism to other species. Experts like Lori Marino believe this demonstrates orcas' capacity for generalized altruism and interspecies experimentation. Towers argues this shows orcas possess theory of mind, understanding that others have distinct mental states.

This behavior could be driven by curiosity and the exploration of relationships in their environment. The orcas benefit from cooperation, and sometimes have excess prey to spare, allowing them to explore their surroundings. Such behavior is an advantage for generalist predators by reducing uncertainty, and actively learning about humans by testing boundaries.

这种行为类似于虎鲸群内部的猎物分享，但将利他主义扩展到了其他物种。洛里·马里诺等专家认为，这表明虎鲸具有普遍的利他主义和跨物种实验的能力。托尔斯认为，这表明虎鲸具有心理理论，能够理解其他人拥有不同的心理状态。

title: Explainer: Inodes and Inode Numbers
summary:
This article explains inodes and inode numbers, fundamental data structures used by file systems to identify files and directories. Inodes, short for index nodes, are numbered data structures, and their unique numbers (inode numbers) identify objects within a file system.

The article details how different file systems handle these identifiers. HFS+, the Mac's older file system, doesn't use true inodes, but uses Catalogue Node IDs (CNIDs) as inode numbers due to Unix API requirements. APFS, Apple's modern file system, directly implements inodes using 64-bit unsigned integers. It also addresses how APFS handles inode numbers in volume groups of firmlinked System and Data volumes to ensure uniqueness.

Beyond simple identification, inodes contain critical file metadata, including timestamps, permissions, and file extent records pointing to the actual data. Files can also have extended attributes stored alongside the inode.

The article further explains the role of inode numbers in linking files. Copying creates a new file with a new inode, duplicating creates a clone file with a distinct inode sharing data. Symbolic links don't involve inodes, while hard links create multiple objects that all point to the same inode and keep a count of those links, enabling the deletion of one object without affecting the data or any other hard links. Finally, the article notes that inode numbers can be easily accessed via command-line tools like `ls -i`.
chinese_title: 解释器：inode和inode编号
chinese_summary:
本文解释了inode和inode编号，文件系统用于识别文件和目录的基本数据结构。inodes，即索引节点的缩写，是带编号的数据结构，其唯一的编号（inode编号）用于标识文件系统中的对象。

本文详细介绍了不同的文件系统如何处理这些标识符。HFS+，Mac较旧的文件系统，由于Unix API的要求，不使用真正的inode，而是使用目录节点ID（CNID）作为inode编号。APFS，Apple的现代文件系统，直接使用64位无符号整数实现inode。它还阐述了APFS如何在软链接的系统和数据卷的卷组中处理inode编号，以确保唯一性。

除了简单的识别，inode还包含关键的文件元数据，包括时间戳、权限和指向实际数据的扩展记录。文件还可以具有与inode一起存储的扩展属性。

本文进一步解释了inode编号在链接文件中的作用。复制会创建一个新的文件，并具有一个新的inode，而克隆会创建一个具有不同inode的克隆文件，但共享数据。符号链接不涉及inode，而硬链接会创建多个指向同一inode的对象，并记录这些链接的数量，从而可以在不影响数据或任何其他硬链接的情况下删除一个对象。最后，本文指出可以通过`ls -i`等命令行工具轻松访问inode编号。

title: Which table format do LLMs understand best?
summary:
This article explores the impact of different data formats on the accuracy and cost of using LLMs with tabular data. The authors conducted an experiment using GPT-4.1-nano, 1,000 synthetic employee records, and 1,000 randomized questions, testing 11 different data formats.

The key finding is that **data format significantly affects LLM accuracy.** Markdown-KV (a custom "key: value" format) achieved the highest accuracy (60.7%), while CSV and JSONL performed poorly.  This suggests that choosing the right format can lead to quick accuracy gains. However, a trade-off exists: **higher accuracy often means higher token costs.** Markdown-KV used 2.7 times more tokens than CSV.

The article suggests Markdown-KV as a good default when accuracy is paramount, and Markdown tables as a balance between readability and cost. It advises caution when using CSV or JSONL.  The authors acknowledge limitations, including testing only one model and data pattern. Future research should explore different models, data structures (nested data), table sizes with header repetition, and question types.

The main takeaway is that simple data transformations could significantly improve the accuracy of LLM-based systems, and it's worth testing different formats to find the optimal one for a given application.
chinese_title: LLM最能理解哪种表格格式？

关键发现是**数据格式显著影响大型语言模型的准确性。** Markdown-KV（一种自定义的“键: 值”格式）实现了最高的准确率（60.7%），而CSV和JSONL表现不佳。这表明选择正确的格式可以快速提高准确性。然而，存在一个权衡：**更高的准确性通常意味着更高的token成本。** Markdown-KV使用的token数量是CSV的2.7倍。

本文建议在对准确性要求极高时，将Markdown-KV作为良好的默认选择，并将Markdown表格作为可读性和成本之间的平衡。建议在使用CSV或JSONL时要谨慎。作者承认局限性，包括仅测试了一个模型和数据模式。未来的研究应探索不同的模型、数据结构（嵌套数据）、带有标题重复的表格大小以及问题类型。

主要结论是，简单的数据转换可以显著提高基于大型语言模型的系统的准确性，并且值得测试不同的格式，以找到适用于特定应用程序的最佳格式。

title: Joint Book Review: Class, by Paul Fussell
summary:
This is a joint book review of Paul Fussell's "Class: A Guide Through the American Status System" by Jane and John Psmith. The review explores Fussell's analysis of the American class system and its subtle, often unspoken, indicators.

Jane argues that while Americans may not explicitly discuss class, it heavily influences their behavior, values, and online interactions. She highlights Fussell's point that perceptions of class shift depending on where one falls within the hierarchy, with those "at the top" dictating the criteria for belonging. She then summarizes Fussell's nine classes: top out-of-sight, upper, upper-middle, middle, three levels of proletarian, destitute, and bottom out-of-sight. She distinguishes the upper class by wealth, eccentricity, and anti-intellectualism; the upper-middle class by education and sophistication; the middle class by its desire for respectability and use of euphemisms; and the proles by their pride in manual labor and displays of brand names. Jane argues that indicators of classiness include naturalness, labor-intensiveness, age, and understatement.

John expresses concern about the book's potential to strip away comforting illusions and make one see society in a more critical, potentially cynical, way. He compares it to learning about clouds or history in a way that permanently alters one's perspective. He suggests the book is potentially dangerous and should be approached with caution.

title: CHERI with a Linux on Top
summary:
This LWN.net article discusses the CHERI (Capability Hardware Enhanced RISC Instructions) project, which aims to improve computer security through a rethinking of computer architecture, specifically by extending instruction-set architectures (ISAs) to support capabilities. Capabilities are unforgeable tokens that combine a reference to an object (like memory) and access rights, providing fine-grained access control.

Carl Shaw presented at the Linux Security Summit Europe (LSS EU) on the efforts to run Linux on CHERI, highlighting the history of capabilities and their potential for enhancing security in operating systems. While early implementations suffered from performance issues due to indirection, modern approaches like CHERI avoid this.

CHERI has been implemented on MIPS, Arm (Morello), and RISC-V. It adopts a hybrid approach, allowing it to work with existing systems that use integer pointers, while leveraging capabilities for memory safety and compartmentalization. Key features of CHERI include deterministic operation, hardware/software co-design, and the ability to protect against memory safety vulnerabilities common in C and C++ code.

The article notes that a pure-capability version of the Linux kernel (6.16) has been successfully run, where every pointer in the kernel is now a capability. Codasip is actively developing this purecap version for RISC-V. While FreeBSD already has advanced security features via CheriBSD, the Linux port is focused on functionality first. The article also mentions challenges in adapting the Linux kernel to CHERI, such as pointer type mismatches and structure alignment issues. The ultimate goal is to upstream compatible changes to the Linux kernel.

Carl Shaw 在欧洲 Linux 安全峰会 (LSS EU) 上介绍了在 CHERI 上运行 Linux 的工作，强调了能力的历史及其增强操作系统安全性的潜力。虽然早期的实现由于间接性而受到性能问题的影响，但像 CHERI 这样的现代方法避免了这一点。

title: Should I choose Ada, SPARK, or Rust over C/C++? (2024)
summary:
This article from AdaCore compares C/C++ with Ada/SPARK and Rust for developing high-integrity embedded systems. While C/C++ is the common default, it's argued to be riskier for safety and security. Ada and Rust offer safer alternatives.

Rust has a large, vibrant community and a flexible memory model, while Ada has a smaller but mature ecosystem with a complete toolchain and certification documentation. Ada also offers a powerful specification language for expressing and checking software/hardware constraints.

SPARK, based on Ada, offers industrial-strength formal methods to mathematically prove software safety and security, eliminating potential vulnerabilities statically at compile time. This can lead to cost savings by reducing the need for extensive testing.

The article highlights differences in community size, toolchain maturity, certification availability, and available libraries between the three languages. Ada/SPARK have mature embedded toolchains and certification evidence, while Rust is rapidly developing in those areas. Rust boasts a larger library ecosystem, but many are hobbyist-developed and lack the rigor needed for safety-critical applications.

All three languages offer ways to mitigate programming errors with Ada/SPARK providing strong typing. Ultimately, the best choice depends on the project's specific needs, the team's willingness to adopt new technologies, and the importance placed on factors like formal verification and long-term support.

title: Estimating AI energy use
summary:
This article, "The Hidden Behemoth Behind Every AI Answer," explores the escalating energy demands of generative AI, focusing on ChatGPT as a prime example. The author, Matthew S. Smith, highlights that seemingly simple queries require massive computational resources, leading to significant energy consumption.

Using OpenAI's reported 2.5 billion daily queries for ChatGPT, combined with an estimated 0.34 watt-hours per query (a figure cited by Sam Altman), the article calculates a daily energy usage of 850 megawatt-hours. Annually, this equates to powering approximately 29,000 US homes.

However, ChatGPT is only part of the picture. The article references a Schneider Electric Sustainability Research Institute report estimating overall generative AI power consumption at 15 terawatt-hours in 2025, projecting a staggering increase to 347 terawatt-hours by 2030. This growth implies a need for significant infrastructure development, potentially requiring dozens of "Stargate-class" data centers, each consuming 8.76 TWh annually.

The article emphasizes that AI inference, the power used during interaction with AI models, will be the primary driver of this energy consumption growth. The rise of AI agents working independently could further exacerbate energy use. While estimates vary, the consensus points to a dramatic surge in energy consumption due to the proliferation of generative AI.

chinese_title: Show HN: ut – 基于 Rust 的面向开发者和 IT 人员的 CLI 工具集
chinese_summary:
`ut` 是一个基于 Rust 的 CLI 实用工具包，专为开发者和 IT 专业人士设计，旨在将常用工具整合到一个轻量级的二进制文件中。这消除了多次安装的需要，并减轻了记住各个命令的认知负担。

该工具包通过 `cargo install` 安装，并使用 `ut <工具> [选项]` 调用。它拥有广泛的工具集，组织成以下类别：

*   **编码:** base64 和 URL 编码/解码。
*   **哈希:** 密码学哈希摘要 (MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, 等)。
*   **数据生成:** UUID 生成 (v1, v3, v4, v5, v7), 安全令牌, lorem ipsum, 和随机数。
*   **文本处理:** 大小写转换, 美化打印转义字符, 和文本差异比较。
*   **开发工具:** 表达式计算器, JSON 构建器, 交互式正则表达式测试器, 和日期时间解析/转换。
*   **Web & 网络:** HTTP 实用工具 (状态码查找, 本地文件服务器) 和二维码生成。
*   **颜色 & 设计:** 颜色格式转换。
*   **参考:** Unicode 符号参考。

`ut` 强调速度、独立运行 (无依赖)、通过 stdin/stdout 实现可组合性、使用密码学安全随机数生成器的安全性，以及跨平台兼容性。该项目欢迎贡献，并承认在开发过程中使用了 AI 辅助编码 (Claude Code)。

title: The death of industrial design and the era of dull electronics
summary:
This article argues that industrial design in consumer electronics is dying, leading to an era of dull, indistinguishable devices. It contrasts the bold and colorful designs of the past, particularly the "Y2K Aesthetic" and "Frutiger Aero" eras of the late 90s and early 2000s, with the current trend of flat, geometric "slabs" lacking unique features.

The author points to cellphones and TVs as prime examples, noting how they have evolved into featureless rectangles dominated by screens, devoid of physical buttons, tactile controls, and distinctive styling. This "evolution" extends to computers and even car interiors, where touchscreens replace physical controls.

The article attributes this decline to a focus on minimalist design and a reliance on software-based interfaces via smartphone apps. This outsourcing of the user interface to apps has led to frustrating experiences and even rendered devices unusable, as exemplified by the Sonos app debacle.

The author suggests that the "revival of physical media" and "retro-computing" stem from a desire for a more engaging and stimulating experience, where tactile interaction and visually pleasing designs offer a welcome contrast to the lifeless slabs of modern electronics. The lack of such engagement in modern electronics leads to boredom and a need for enrichment activities, potentially justifying a return to older, more expressive design principles.
chinese_title: 工业设计的消亡与乏味电子产品的时代
chinese_summary:
本文认为消费电子产品中的工业设计正在走向消亡，导致一个充斥着乏味、难以区分的设备的时代。它将过去大胆而多彩的设计，特别是90年代末和2000年代初的“Y2K美学”和“未来主义航空”时代，与当前缺乏独特特征的扁平、几何“平板”趋势形成对比。

作者以手机和电视为例，指出它们是如何演变成以屏幕为主的、没有特点的矩形，缺乏物理按钮、触觉控制和独特的造型。这种“进化”延伸到电脑甚至汽车内饰，触摸屏取代了物理控制。

文章将这种衰落归因于对极简主义设计的关注以及对通过智能手机应用程序实现的基于软件界面的依赖。这种将用户界面外包给应用程序的做法导致了令人沮丧的体验，甚至使设备无法使用，Sonos应用程序的惨败就是一个例证。

作者认为“实体媒体的复兴”和“复古计算”源于对更具吸引力和刺激性的体验的渴望，触觉互动和视觉上令人愉悦的设计为现代电子产品的死板平板提供了令人欣慰的对比。现代电子产品缺乏这种互动会导致无聊和对丰富活动的需要，这可能证明了回归更古老、更具表现力的设计原则是合理的。

title: The best worst hack that saved our bacon
summary:
This article recounts a near-disaster averted by a clever, albeit unconventional, hack. The author describes how their calendar platform was rapidly approaching the limit of its 32-bit integer primary key for event occurrences, threatening a complete system failure. A long-term solution involving migrating to big integers was already in progress, but a last-minute realization that the integer keys were exposed via a public API posed a significant problem. Changing the API could break existing customer integrations, many of which were managed by slow-moving university IT departments.

Faced with this dilemma, the team implemented a "stupid simple" solution: resetting the primary key sequence to the negative side of the 32-bit integer range, effectively doubling their available key space. This bought them up to three years to properly migrate while ensuring API integrations would not be disrupted.

The author emphasizes that this was a deliberate and well-understood technical debt. They immediately set a strict deadline for the BigInt migration and thoroughly investigated API dependencies, working with the Customer Success team to proactively inform and assist affected customers. The long-term solution was not just the migration, but also to abstract the internal IDs with opaque handles, and to ensure that users don't count on the type of those IDs in the future.

While acknowledging the absurdity of the hack, the author argues that it was the right decision under the circumstances, buying them crucial time and allowing for a smooth transition to a more robust and future-proof system. The takeaway is not to use negative primary keys, but to highlight the responsible application of technical debt when facing critical situations, coupled with a clear plan for its timely resolution.
chinese_title: 救了我们一命的烂招/最烂但救命的奇招
chinese_summary:
本文讲述了一次巧妙但非常规的变通方案如何避免了一场近乎灾难的事故。作者描述了他们的日历平台正迅速逼近其事件发生的 32 位整数主键的上限，威胁着整个系统的崩溃。迁移到大整数的长期解决方案已经在进行中，但最后一刻意识到整数键通过公共 API 公开造成了一个重大问题。更改 API 可能会破坏现有的客户集成，其中许多集成由行动迟缓的大学 IT 部门管理。

面对这一困境，团队实施了一个“愚蠢的简单”的解决方案：将主键序列重置为 32 位整数范围的负数侧，从而有效地将其可用键空间增加了一倍。这为他们争取了长达三年的时间来正确迁移，同时确保 API 集成不会中断。

作者强调这是一个经过深思熟虑且充分理解的技术债务。他们立即为 BigInt 迁移设定了一个严格的截止日期，并彻底调查了 API 依赖关系，与客户成功团队合作，主动通知并帮助受影响的客户。长期的解决方案不仅仅是迁移，还要用不透明的句柄抽象内部 ID，并确保用户将来不会依赖这些 ID 的类型。

虽然承认这种变通方案的荒谬性，但作者认为在当时的情况下这是正确的决定，为他们赢得了关键的时间，并允许平稳过渡到更强大和面向未来的系统。关键不在于使用负数主键，而是强调在面临危急情况时负责任地应用技术债务，并制定明确的及时解决计划。

title: FSF turns forty with a groundbreaking new project and a new president
summary:
The Free Software Foundation (FSF) celebrated its fortieth anniversary with FSF40, an event packed with discussions, announcements, and community engagement. A key highlight was the introduction of Ian Kelling as the new FSF president, who pledged to strengthen the FSF's ability to defend user freedom and expand the free software community.

The event featured prominent free software activists sharing their experiences and volunteers discussing their work on various projects like GNU, EmacsConf, Debian, and Trisquel. Executive director Zoë Kooyman unveiled LibrePhone, a new FSF initiative aiming to bring software freedom to mobile computing in partnership with developer Rob Savoye.

The FSF also reaffirmed its commitment to local events and updated attendees on its progress in developing free machine learning criteria. LibreLocal group leaders shared insights into their regional communities, covering their activities, successes, and challenges.

A panel discussion featuring representatives from the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF), F-Droid, FSF, and Sugar Labs addressed software freedom, privacy, mobile freedom, and the importance of free software in education. The event concluded with expressions of gratitude to the countless contributors who have supported the free software movement over the past forty years.

title: Social Cooling (2017)
summary:
"Social Cooling" argues that the increasing collection and analysis of personal data are leading to a society characterized by self-censorship, risk aversion, and decreased social evolution. Similar to how oil leads to global warming, the article contends that data leads to "social cooling."

Data brokers compile vast amounts of information to predict personal attributes like religion, political views, and even "gullibility," creating detailed "digital reputations." These reputations can negatively impact opportunities, leading to discrimination in employment, loan applications, and even dating.

The article posits that this constant surveillance and potential for judgment causes individuals to modify their behavior to achieve better "scores," leading to conformity and risk aversion. Examples include hesitating to click certain links, doctors avoiding treating high-risk patients, and China's social credit system, which restricts opportunities for those deemed "badly behaved."

The author argues this shift threatens free speech, creativity, and societal progress. They advocate for increased awareness and a more nuanced understanding of data and privacy, drawing a parallel to the fight against global warming. The solution lies in protecting the right to make mistakes and ensuring individuals have the right to be forgotten in the data-driven world. The author, Tijmen Schep, encourages sharing this information to promote a more privacy-conscious society.

title: Period-Correct Graphics in PC Emulators: Part 1 – The Amiga
summary:
This article, the first in a series, focuses on achieving period-correct graphics when emulating classic computers, specifically the Commodore Amiga. The author argues that emulated graphics should closely resemble the output of CRT displays used with these computers in the 80s and 90s, emphasizing the differences between CRT technology used per platform.

The article primarily focuses on emulating the Commodore 1084S monitor, a common pairing with the Amiga, within the WinUAE emulator. It highlights the importance of analog RGB output over composite, and emphasizes that the only real difference between "PAL" and "NTSC" over RGB is the vertical refresh rate, more accurately termed RGB 50 and RGB 60.

A significant portion is dedicated to refuting the idea of sharp, rectangular pixels being the ideal for all emulated systems. The author contrasts the VGA PC experience with the Amiga, explaining that Amiga monitors, being essentially small TVs, used single-scanning techniques with lower vertical resolution, resulting in noticeable scanlines and a softer image. This contrasts sharply with the double-scanned, high-resolution output of VGA monitors.

The author contends that CRT shaders are crucial for authentically recreating the Amiga's visual output. They argue that "pixel art" on the Amiga was designed to be viewed on CRTs, where the electron beam blended and smoothed the image, creating a higher perceived resolution and minimizing jagged edges. The article positions the pixel grid as a control mechanism for the electron beam, rather than a direct representation of pixels on screen, concluding that authentic emulation of CRT effects enhances the viewing experience of Amiga games and graphics.
